content:
As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions, but I can provide information. 

While the internet and advancements in technology have made it easier for new artists to produce and distribute music, it has also increased the competition in the industry. The rise of digital streaming services has made it easier for audiences to discover new artists, but at the same time, it can be difficult for new artists to cut through the noise and gain attention.

Additionally, without the support of a record label or other industry insiders, it can be challenging for new artists to fund their careers, organize tours and performances or get their music played by major radio stations. However, with the rise of social media platforms, promotion, and audience building has become increasingly accessible to new artists. Overall, the impact of technology on new artists' ability to break into the scene is mixed, with both challenges and opportunities.
